issue.title: Precondition on is_convertible is too strong

discussion.p: Per Table 49 in , the preconditions for both is_convertible<From, To> and is_nothrow_convertible<From, To> are:

blockquote.p: From and To shall be complete types, arrays of unknown bound, or cv void types.

discussion.p: has undefined behavior despite that the actual behavior of is_convertible specified in [meta.rel]/5:

blockquote.p: -5- The predicate condition for a template specialization is_­convertible<From, To> shall be satisfied if and only if the return expression in the following code would be well-formed, including any implicit conversions to the return type of the function:

discussion.p: is well-formed: declval<S>() is an xvalue of type S, which certainly does implicitly convert to const S&. We should relax the precondition to allow this perfectly valid case (and similar cases like is_convertible<S, S&&>), letting the cases that would in fact be invalid fall through to the blanket "incompletely-defined object type" wording in [meta.rqmts]/5.

resolution.p: This wording is relative to N4791.
